comments.text: Good apot woth shadow lot of people go. We fpjnd a ride in 10 min
Not a lot a traffic and it was the end of the day. I walked a little bit and a motorbike stops. I did all the way to the city with him and he let me in a guest house 😊
The driver was going into the city and I wanted to stay in the main road, but I stayed a long way with him.
A car give me a lift to where he was going. Good spot, you can hide under the bridge if you need shadow, some smalls shops on the road in front.
Lots of taxis and tuktuk stops but some cars too, just be patient.
First car stops directly, he was going back to Phnom Penh and I was going in Battambang direction so he let me here just before the cross road.
Just after the traffic light on the right in the shadow of a shop 😊.

Super good spot, shade for most of the day from a big banner/billboard over the road. Heaps of room for cars to pull in. I think it’s better than what is suggested on hitch wiki.
Had to fend off a few taxi but got a lift direct to Battambang

This spots a bit tricky depending on the time of day. Unfortunately most of the day it’s Vietnamese trucks which don’t go to Phnom Penh (if you’re going that way). It’s best to move a bit back from the Cambodian side of the boarder. Only maybe 100m and you’ll see that all the cars that drop people at the boarder chuck a u-ie and then come past you. Most will ask for money but with a Phnom Penh sign I got a free lift in ~30 mins (30 mins waiting at the boarder in the wrong spot)

Long road with no turns and space for cars to stop, easy to hitch to the south. Found direct ride to Phnom-Penh in less than 10min. Few vans will stop and ask for money, makes it a safety if you need to reach your destination absolutely
Cheap tuktuk ride from harbour, in two minutes had 3 vans and one car that stopped, car took us to Phnom-Penh. Petrol station before the big roundabout leading to highway.
Petrol station, shadow available, quite easy to hitch a ride to Kratie here.

There are huge trees at the roadside that provide shade. You will see one but you might have to walk there for 100 meters because apparently they are removed sometimes. A sign for Bavet helps if you want to get to the vietnamese border. A lot of trucks come by here, they are your best chance.
Got a direct ride to Siem Reap here. Pretty random spot though.
Good spot with a shadow and plenty of room for drivers to break. We got an easy ride to Skun in 5 minutes.

Easy to head east/north east from here, easy access from city center with bus 6. Lots of vans will stop and ask for money but some will take you for free. Got a direct ride to Kampong Cham in 5min in a local van.

Take bus number 6 from Old Stadium Roundabout and get off at the turn to Win Win Boulevard. There is a gas station, also you can move a bit further to find a spot. Traffic is quite messy. Many tuk-tuks and minivan taxis. Most drivers will expect a payment, so tell them about your intentions beforehand.
Kinda regular Cambodian traffic, decent spot but sometimes cars from the north road block traffic from seeing you. Had a sign for Poipet. Got lucky and an already crowded bus picked me up.
After 40min we got a ride to Anlong Veng (right to Ta Mok's house). Traffic is average, not many motorbikes and tuk-tuks.

There is a little shop. The lady in the shop seemed to have met hitchhikers here before, as she approached us with chairs, question in google translate "do you want to travel with no payment?", and also offered us a cardboard to make a sign. Just because it's right after the turn from Skun it makes it more difficult for cars that are going from Phnom Penh direction to stop. Anyway, you can chill there, get some cold drink, and wait for your ride to Siem Reap.
